approve(string,address,uint32,address,by.details: register upkeep on KeeperRegistry contract and emit RegistrationApproved event

params.senderAddress: address to read the allowlist status for

params.amount: Amount of LINK sent (specified in Juels)
params.sender: Address of the sender transfering LINK

params.adminAddress: address to cancel upkeep and withdraw remaining funds
params.amount: quantity of LINK upkeep is funded with (specified in Juels)
params.checkData: data passed to the contract when checking for upkeep
params.gasLimit: amount of gas to provide the target contract when performing upkeep
params.name: string of the upkeep to be registered
params.sender: address of the sender making the request

params.allowed: true if senderAddress needs to be added to allowlist, false if needs to be removed
params.senderAddress: senderAddress to set the allowlist status for

params.autoApproveConfigType: setting for auto-approve registrations                   note: autoApproveAllowedSenders list persists across config changes irrespective of type
params.autoApproveMaxAllowed: max number of registrations that can be auto approved
params.minLINKJuels: minimum LINK that new registrations should fund their upkeep with

acceptOwnership().notice: Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.

cancel(bytes32).notice: cancel will remove a registration request and return the refunds to the msg.sender

getAutoApproveAllowedSender(address).notice: read the allowlist status of senderAddress

getPendingRequest(bytes32).notice: gets the admin address and the current balance of a registration request

onTokenTransfer(address,uint256,bytes).notice: Called when LINK is sent to the contract via `transferAndCall`

register(string,bytes,address,uint32,add.notice: register can only be called through transferAndCall on LINK contract

setAutoApproveAllowedSender(address,bool.notice: owner calls this function to set allowlist status for senderAddress

setRegistrationConfig(uint8,uint16,addre.notice: owner calls this function to set if registration requests should be sent directly to the Keeper Registry

transferOwnership(address).notice: Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address, pending.

typeAndVersion().notice: versions: - KeeperRegistrar 1.1.0: Add functionality for sender allowlist in auto approve                        : Remove rate limit and add max allowed for auto approve - KeeperRegistrar 1.0.0: initial release

documentation.text:
@notice versions:
 - KeeperRegistrar 1.1.0: Add functionality for sender allowlist in auto approve
                        : Remove rate limit and add max allowed for auto approve
 - KeeperRegistrar 1.0.0: initial release
@dev register upkeep on KeeperRegistry contract and emit RegistrationApproved event

@notice cancel will remove a registration request and return the refunds to the msg.sender
 @param hash the request hash

@notice read the allowlist status of senderAddress
 @param senderAddress address to read the allowlist status for
@notice gets the admin address and the current balance of a registration request
@dev register upkeep on KeeperRegistry contract and emit RegistrationApproved event
@dev verify sender allowlist if needed and check max limit
@dev Reverts if not sent from the LINK token

@dev Reverts if the given data does not begin with the `register` function selector
 @param _data The data payload of the request

@notice Contract to accept requests for upkeep registrations
 @dev There are 2 registration workflows in this contract
 Flow 1. auto approve OFF / manual registration - UI calls `register` function on this contract, this contract owner at a later time then manually
  calls `approve` to register upkeep and emit events to inform UI and others interested.
 Flow 2. auto approve ON / real time registration - UI calls `register` function as before, which calls the `registerUpkeep` function directly on
  keeper registry and then emits approved event to finish the flow automatically without manual intervention.
 The idea is to have same interface(functions,events) for UI or anyone using this contract irrespective of auto approve being enabled or not.
 they can just listen to `RegistrationRequested` & `RegistrationApproved` events and know the status on registrations.
